result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Kristen N Popp in court with attorney Erika Amundson.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF97, 16CF120, 16CM50, 16CM51, 16CM85.    Agreement has been reached in all matters.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  

16CF120-Ct 3, NC
                 Ct 4, NC  Court accepts, finds DE guilty.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  Will order sentence withheld, 3 years probation, 59 days jail, credit for 59 days, CC/DNA sample and surcharge, expunction of cases if successful with probation, AODA assessment, comply with all follow up recommendations,  DE must obtain HSED or GED while on probation.  Bond will go towards court costs.

All other cases will be DRI

Defendant Kristen N Popp in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  Defendant Kristen N Popp in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
